comments:
I'm using Eclipse 3.0M8 and CDT 3.0M8 on Slackware Linux 9.1 
 
Sometimes when I close eclipse after a work session the "Saving Workspace" 
progress dialog just hang. It saves the workspace and the progress bar moves 
all the way to the right, but then it just sits there. I've tried leaving it 
alone for up to 5 minutes but it doesn't seem to ever want to close - I have to 
manually kill the PID of eclipse to get it to go away. 
I don't know if this is a CDT bug or a Eclipse bug, but when looking in my .log 
file the last time this happened I saw this in the last entry: !MESSAGE Error 
while stopping 
"reference:file:/home/juhl/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.cdt.core_2.0.0/ [97]". 
which is why I'm filing this as a cdt-core bug.  Below is the entire entry from 
the .log file in case it is of any use :

The cdt.core plugin been move to use the Eclipes-3.0
way OSGI bundle scheme.  We no longer use the Compatibiltiy
plugin.

Note:  We still use it for cdt.ui.

Reopen the PR if you still see this.

Flipping to Fix
